conclusion: To determine at which moment the two objects are farthest apart, we need to analyze the area under the velocity-time graph for each object. The area under the curve represents the displacement of each object.
Object A: The graph shows a decreasing velocity from v0 to 0.
Object B: The graph shows an increasing velocity from 0 to v0.

premise: The area under the velocity-time graph represents displacement.
conclusion: For Object A, the displacement is the area under the curve from t = 0 to t = t2.

premise: The area under the velocity-time graph represents displacement.
conclusion: For Object B, the displacement is the area under the curve from t = 0 to t = t2.

premise: The maximum separation occurs when the difference in the areas under the curves is the greatest.
conclusion: At t = t2, Object A has reached its maximum displacement, and Object B has just started moving.

conclusion: The two objects are farthest apart at t = t2.
